WorkPlace.Name: Rope Robotics ApS
WorkPlace.Description: Did you know that in Denmark the investment in automation and robots have tripled since 1966? In the same period more people have also been employed, hence automation seems to change jobs not removing jobs. Would you like to be a part of the changed future? Martin, engineer at a wind turbine manufacture decided to start automating wind turbine service. Rope Robotics is the world's leading robot supplier for wind turbine blade service. We are located in Aarhus currently with 16 employees and plan

JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Wind Turbine Blade Service Robot Operator
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
The Opportunity
Now we have an opening for a robot operator with electrical troubleshooting experience preferable within the wind turbine service business and with eager to learn how to operate new technology. Responsible for executing efficient, safe, high quality on time blade repairs all over the world. Rope Robotics can offer a progressive working environment with a broad range of responsibilities. You will be a part of a small and efficient team with a short way from idea to action. In this role you will work the team, in close interaction with the whole organization, in delivering high quality service to our customers.

The Job:

  • Execute Rope Robotics blade service
    • Turbine stop/start and preparation for robot operation
    • Prepare robot for operation
    • Control robot from mobile operation center
  • Train new robot operators
  • Train and support 3rd party robot operators
  • Troubleshooting and service of robots
  • Support testing of new software, processes and mechanical design updates
  • Improving process for more efficient and safe operation

Who are we looking for?
We are looking for someone who has a systematic and result oriented approach to work. In this role it will be crucial to work structured but also pragmatic and creative with the tasks and challenges. You work independently, take responsibility and have a hands-on approach to the work. You prefer to find a solution today rather than tomorrow but are also patient when new technology or bureaucracy demands it. You love traveling and working abroad is a natural part of your work.

You have 1+ years of experience as wind turbine technician. You have experience troubleshooting work, being electrician, “automatiktekniker”, marine engineer or likewise and GWO BST certified. You like to work with IT systems and new technologies.

Call to action!

We offer fantastic work environment and exciting challenges in an innovative company at the leading edge of robot technology.

For further information, please contact Martin Huus Bjerge on tel.: +45 6177 2641 or by e-mail in English or Danish job@RopeRobotics.com.

Deadline for Application: As soon as possible, we will read application and call for interviews continually.
